Standard Normal Distribution

item.title: Attention
item.description:
defintion

  • Sternberg: Focusing limited mental resources on the information and cognitive process that are most salient at a given moment

Aspects of Attention

  • Selective attention: sensory input 중 어느걸 선택할지
  • Focused attention: 하던 과업을 까먹는것
  • Divided attention: multitasking. 각각의 과업에 우선순위를 어떻게 배분?
  • Sustained attention: 주의를 얼마나 오래 유지할 수 있는가?
  • Mental workload: 이런걸 어떻게 측정할까?

Driven by meaning and by change

  • Voluntary
  • Captured by salient and grouping

Selective attention

  • Top-down: mental model
  • Bottom-up: salient sources, information access trade-offs

Attention may be a filter / gateway / bottleneck for seonsory info

Devided Attention

Model

  • Central resource theory
  • Multiple resource theory

Change Blindness

  • Under high workload requiring central executive of working memory
  • 눈에 확 띄는 변화는 알아차리기 쉽다
  • 중심시에서 떨어진 변화는 알아차리기 어렵다
  • 안 보고 있을 때 변화를 알아차리기 어렵다
  • 이벤트가 일어날 가능성이 높으면 알아차리기 쉽다
  • fixation보다 attention이 더 중요하다

해결책

  • 변화가 일어나는 곳을 중심시로
  • 주변시 잘 알아차리기 쉽게(flashing, movement) 자극을 만들어줌
  • 변화가 일어날 수도 있는 expentancy를 높여줌

Selective Attention Task

  • Serial Search
  • Parallel Search

Attention as Capacity

맨 위로

item.title: R05
item.description:
확률분포 관련 함수

d-function

확률분포함수 f(x)를 계산

# 이항 분포 (x, size, prob)
dbinom(5, 8, 1/6)
x.prob <- dbinom(0:8, 8, 1/6)
round(x.prob, 3)
sum(x.prob)
plot(0:8, x.prob, type="h", lwd=2, col="blue", ylab="f(x)", xlab="x", main="X~B(8, 1/6)")

# 초기하 분포 (성공횟수, 실패횟수, 표본 갯수)
hg <- dhyper(0:10, m=15, n=25, k=10)
round(hg, 3)
plot(0:10, hg, type="h", lwd=2, col="blue", ylab="f(x)", xlab="x", main="X~HG(10, 40, 15)")
hg40 <- dhyper(0:10, m=15, n=25, k=10)
hg80 <- dhyper(0:10, m=30, n=50, k=10)
hg400 <- dhyper(0:10, m=150, n=250, k=10)
binom <- dbinom(0:10, 10, 3/8)
plot(1:10, hg40, type="h", lwd=2, col="lightblue", ylab="f(x)", xlab="x", main="X~HG(10, 40, 15)")
lines(1:10+0.2, hg80, type="h", lwd=2, col="mistyrose")
lines(1:10+0.4, hg400, type="h", lwd=2, col="lightgreen")
lines(1:10-0.6, binom, type="h", lwd=2, col="pink")

# 포아송 분포 (x, lambda)
dpois(3, 3.5)
round(dpois(0:10, 3.5), 3)

# 기하 분포 (x, prob)
dgeom(4, 0.3)

p-function

누적분포함수 F(x)를 계산
연속확률분포에서 자주 쓰임

pbinom(q=3, 8, 1/6) # P(X<=3)
sum(dbinom(0:3, 8, 1/6))
1 - pbinom(q=3, 8, 1/6) # P(X>3)

ppois(3, 3.5) # P(X<=3)

q-function

분위수를 계산 (F(x)의 역함수)
연속확률분포에서 자주 쓰임

qbinom(0.5, 8, 1/6)

r-function

주어진 확률분포로부터 난수를 생성

rbinom(10, 8, 1/6)
rpois(10, 3.5)
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
for (i in c(3,5,7,9)) {
plot(0:20, dpois(0:20, i), type="h", lwd=2, col=i, ylab="f(x)", xlab="x", main=paste("X~Pois(", i, ")"), ylim=c(0, 0.25))
}
맨 위로

item.title: Database Design2
item.description: 맨 위로

item.title: Database Design
item.description:
Purpose of a Database Design

set of database specifications that can be implemented as a database in a DBMS

  • conceptual design: non-DBMS specific
  • logical design: DBMS specific
  • physical design: DBMS specific but not implemented directly by humans

Logical Design(Relational Design)

  1. Create a table(relation) for each entity
  • specify primary key
  • specify properties for each column
    • data type
    • constraints
    • default value
    • null status
  • verify normalization
  1. Create relationships by placing foreign keys:
  • Strong entity relationships
  • ID-dependent / non-ID-dependent weak entity relationships
  • Subtypes
  • Recursive

Denormalization

  • Normalization 반대로 함
  • 조회시 성능 향성, 조인 불필요 감소 목적

Representing Relationships

Maximum cardinality의 유형에 따라 관계 표현 방법이 달라짐

  • 1:1: foreign key를 어디에 두어도 상관 없음
  • 1:N: many 쪽에 foreign key를 두는 것이 일반적
    1 side is called parent, many side is called child
  • M:N: intersection table을 사용하여 표현
    intersection table에는 두 entity의 primary key를 포함하는 composite key를 가짐
맨 위로

item.title: Mathematical Induction
item.description:
Mathematical Induction

Climbing an Infinite Ladder

  1. can reach the first rung
  2. if can reach k-th rung, can reach (k+1)-th rung

Principle of Mathematical Induction

  • basis step: prove that the statement is true for n=1
  • inductive step: prove that if the statement is true for n=k, then it is true for n=k+1

Important Points About Using Mathematical Induction

Proving a Summation Formula by Mathematical Induction

Conjecturing and Proving Correct a Summation Formula

Proving Inequalities

Proving Divisibility Results

Number of Subsets of a Finite Set(1)

Strong Induction and Well-Ordering

Strong Induction

  • basis step: prove that the statement is true for n=1
  • inductive step: [P(1) ∧ P(2) ∧ … ∧ P(k)] -> P(k+1)

Proof using Strong Induction(2)

Proof of Same Example Using Mathematical Induction

Recursive Definitions and Structural Induction

Recursively Defined Functions

Fibonacci Numbers

Strings

  • Σ = {0, 1}, Σ* = {ε(empty string), 0, 1, 00, 01, 10, 11, 000, …}

String Concatenation

Length of a String

Balanced Parentheses

기말고사 12.06

Recursive Algorithms

Recursive Algorithms

Recursive Exponentiation Algorithm

Recursive GCD Algorithm

Recursive Modular Exponentiation Algorithm

Merge Sort

Recursive Merge Sort

Complexity of Merge Sort

맨 위로

item.title: 이산형 확률분포
item.description:
• 확률분포 정의 단계
    1. 확률 실험 / 시행 (trial)
    2. 표본 공간
    3. 확률변수
    4. 확률분포

베르누이 분포

시행

  1. 각 시행의 결과는 성공(A) 또는 실패(B)
  2. 성공 확률은 p, 실패 확률은 1-p
  3. 각 시행은 서로 독립적

∴ S = {A,B}, f(1) = P(X=1) = p, f(0) = P(X=0) = 1-p)

분포

이항 분포

시행

  • n번의 독립적인 베르누이 시행을 했을 때 성공 횟수 X

분포

  • 표기: , 베르누이: B(1,p)
  • E(x) = np
  • Var(x) = np(1-p)

기하 분포

시행

  • 성공 확률 p인 베르누이 시행을 반복하여 처음 성공할 때까지의 시행 횟수 X

분포

  • 지수분포와 유사하다
  • 표기:
  • E(x) =
  • Var(x) =

특성

  • 기하분포는 비기억 속성을 가진다(지수분포에서 많이 활용됨)
    P(X>x+y|X>x) = P(X>y)
    지수분포도 비기억 속성을 가진다

초기하 분포 (기하분포랑 관련 없음)

시행

  • 성공 확률 p인 베르누이 시행을 반복하여 처음 성공할 때까지의 실패 횟수 X

분포

  • 표기:
  • E(x) =
  • Var(x) =

포아송 분포

  • 평균을 알 때
  • n이 매우 크고 p가 매우 작을 때 이항분포를 포아송분포로 근사할 수 있다
맨 위로

item.title: final
item.description:
집합

  • 집합의 기호 표현
  • 실수의 성질 유계집합, 위로유계 아래로 유계, 상계하계 상한,하한

  • 음함수의 미분법

  • moment:

  • E(x) =

item.title: Signal Detection Theory
item.description:
Overview

  • 인간의 정보 처리 과정 중 perception에 관련된 것
  • 인공지능 분야에서 중요성이 대두되고 있음
  • siganal 탐지 과정을 정량적 모델로 분석하고 성능 평가가 목표
  • 여러가지 신호 중 무엇이 중요한지 판단하는 것

Example

  • Quality control inspector
    빵이나 과자가 찌그러졌는지 검사, 반도체 품질 검사. 요즘에는 기계가 대부분 담당
  • Detection of a flashing warning light (cctv)
    거수자 탐지
  • Airport security guard
  • Detecting peculiar patterns in medical imaging (x-ray)
    종양, 암세포 탐지
  • Mobile phone rings
    phantoms vibration
  • Morning alarm is active or not

주변의 제품, 서비스 문제 파악, 해결 디자인 제시, 검증

What does it mean to detect?

  • signal is digital (exist / not exist)

  • Absolute threshold is exist => where the threshold?

  • signal vs noise

Signal Detection Theory

  • Trials
    • Signal case(signal + noise): target이 존재
    • Noise case: target이 없음
  • Response
    • Yes
    • No

  • Hit rate: P(Hit) = Number of Hits / Number of Signal Trials
  • False alarm rate: P(FA) = Number of False Alarms / Number of Noise Trials
  • Miss rate: P(Miss) = 1 - P(Hit)
  • Correct rejection rate: P(CR) = 1 - P(FA)

Assumptions

  • 사용자가 관찰할 수 있는 근거는 숫자나 변수로 표현할 수 있어야함 (유사도)
  • evidence는 random variation이 있다
  • simple decision criterion으로 결정할 수 있어야함

Distribution of signal and noise

  • sensitivity index (d’)
    • 값이 작으면 분간 힘듦
    • 값이 크면 분간 쉬움
  • response bias (β)
    • criterion에 따라 yes라고 대답하는 비중과 no라고 대답하는 비중
  • d′이 0, β가 50%면 그냥 랜덤으로 대답한 것과 같음
  • d′을 넓게 하는게 objective
    1. 분포의 mean 차이를 높임
    2. 각각의 분포의 variability를 줄임. (specificity)

d′ 계산

d′ lambda 구하고, 어떤 성향인지 이런거 시험 나온단다

β 계산

  • d′과 관계 없이 조절

계산

  • = 0: ideal observer
  • < 0: liberal. yes라고 대답하는 비중이 늘어, hit rate가 높아지지만 false alarm rate도 높아짐
    ex) 용의자를 찾는 경찰, 암세포 탐지
  • > 0: conservative. no라고 대답하는 비중이 늘어, correct rejection rate가 높아지지만 miss rate도 높아짐
    ex) 억울한 죄인을 만들지 않으려는 범원 판결

Optimal Response Criterion

  • Influenced by Signal Probability and payoffs
  • Signal Probability: P(signal)
맨 위로

item.title: Auditory Haptic
item.description:
Alarms

  • Conspicuous from ambient noise
    15~30dB required

  • Remain within the safe range
    below 85 to 90 dB
    masking 위협때문에 여러 소리를 혼합해서 냄

  • Not disruptive with other signals

  • Informative and distinctive

    1. stereotypic: 어디서 소리가 오는지
    2. pitch physical dimension(pitch(4), duration(4), magnification(4)) <= 4

Non-speech Alarm

  • language independent
    글로벌하게 가고 싶다면

  • Evidence to show they are useful
    fewer mistakes with key click
    video games harder without sound

  • Especially good for transient/background status info

  • use of stereo allow positional information
    비쥬얼로는 3d 표현하기 어려움

Voice Alarm

  • voice is beign accepted as a natural way to interact with devices
  • Able to give more meanings than symbolic alarm
    symbolic alarm은 학습을 해야한다는 단점이 있음
  • Limitations
    1. more confusable with a background sound and communication: 소리가 섞이면 헷갈림
    2. more susceptible to frequency-specific masking
      사람의 voice는 정해진 주파수가 있다.
    3. need to consider the multilingual environment
    4. Sound Transmission Problem

voice recognition

  • Articulation index: pure bottom-up approach
    physical 품질
    0.1: 10% of speech is understood
    0.9: 90% of speech is understood
    1.0: 100% of speech is understood
    0.3: 30% of speech is understood
    0.5: 50% of speech is understood
    0.7: 70% of speech is understood

  • Speech intelligibility measure poor signal quality is compensated by top-down processing
    restricting message set size, redundant carrier sentence

Tactile Perception

  • Touch is complex
  • Only bi-directional communication channel
  • Mechanoreceptor detect skin deformation
  • Tactile acuity is determined by the density of mechanoreceptor
  • Tactile information
    1. feedback by force: 저항감
    2. feedback by vibration
    3. electrical stimulation: 위험해서 적극적으로 쓰이진 않지만 종종 쓰인다. (저주파 마사지)
  • 중요한 정보는 시각, 나머지 feedback은 촉각, 청각으로 받아들임.

Force feedback

  • Kinesthetic information is poduced: 뭘 누를 때 반력 / 저항을 느낌.
    • 큰 물체는 움직이기 어렵게 함 => 더 세밀하게 조종 가능
    • 게임에서 많이 사용됨

vibration feedback

  • using vibration for information transfer
  • similar physical characteristics to auditory signal
    • amplitude, frequency, duration, wave pattern
  • used for navigation aid
맨 위로

item.title: Data Modeling and the Entity-Relationship Model
item.description:
Data and information

  • Data: raw facts. recorded facts
  • Information: meaningful context
  • Knowledge: information + 가치

What is information system?

  • System: a set of components that interact to achieve some purpose or goal
  • Information System: composed of hardware, software, data, procedures, people

System Analysis and Design

  • System analysis and design: process of creating and maintaining information systems
  • classic methodology: SDLC

SDLC (System Development Life Cycle)

  1. System definitions: 예산 편상, 위험 분석, …
  2. Requirements analysis
  3. Component design
  4. Implementation
  5. System maintenance

database development process

  1. Requirements analysis
    input: the project plan
    output: a set of approved requirements -> data model (ER model로 conceptual design)
    source: Use cases, Business rules
  2. Component Design: Relational Database Design (상세 설계)
  3. Implementation

ER model

  • Entities
    • Entity class
    • Entity instance
  • Attributes: Data type, Properties(default, constraints)
  • Identifiers
    • unique
    • Nonunique: identifies a set of instances
  • Relationships
    • binary relationship
      • Maximum cardinality: 1:1(A has a B), 1:N(A has a set of B), M:N
      • Minimum cardinality: 0, 1
    • ternary relationship

Entit-Relationship Diagram

  • Entity classes: rectangle

  • Relationships: diamond

  • maximum cardinality: inside the diamond

  • minimum cardinality: oval or hash mark next to diamond

  • strong entity: 독자적으로 존재 가능. 강한개체 관계는 점선
    Non-ID-dependent: identifier에 다른 entity의 identifier가 포함되어 있지 않음. 점선으로 표기(non-identifying relationship)

  • weak entity: 약, 강 관계는 실선. IS: rounded square, traditional: 2 layer square
    ID-dependent: identifier에 다른 entity의 identifier가 포함되어 있음. 실선으로 표기(identifying relationship)

  • associative entity: relationship이 entity로 변환된 것.
    Many-to-many relationship을 2개의 1:N으로 변환

  • super type, sub type: 상속관계. sub type is a super type

    • exclusive: Discriminator attribute가 필요함
    • inclusive

  • recursive relationship

  • Business rule: build-in constraints, trigger, stored procedure, application code로 구현 가능

  • data model validation: form, report를 이용한 prototyping

맨 위로

item.title: 진도 나갈거 예상
item.description:
1. Number theory and cryptography
  • Number Theory: Properties of integers, divisibility, prime numbers, and modular arithmetic.
  • Cryptography: Techniques for secure communication, including encryption and decryption methods.
  1. Induction and recursion
  • Mathematical Induction: Proof technique used to prove statements about natural numbers.
  • Recursion: Defining functions or sequences where the next term is derived from previous terms.
  1. Counting
  • Combinatorics: Study of counting, arrangement, and combination of objects.
  • Permutations and Combinations: Methods to count arrangements and selections.
  1. Graphs
  • Graph Theory: Study of graphs, which are mathematical structures used to model pairwise relations between objects.
  • Applications: Network analysis, shortest path problems, and graph coloring.
맨 위로

item.title: Algorithm
item.description:
Algorithms

algorithm: finite sequence of precise instructions for performing a computation or for solving a problem.

Pseudo code

완전히 정해진 문법은 없는듯. 이산수학에서 사용하는 형태는 다음과 같다.

Properties of Algorithms

  • Input
  • Output: solution to the problem
  • Definiteness. The steps of an algorithm must be defined precisely.
  • Correctness
  • Finiteness: 무한루프 돌면 안된다.
  • Effectiveness
  • Generality

Example of Algorithms

  • 유한한 정수 집단에서 가장 큰 수 찾기
  • 검색 알고리즘

    • 선형 검색

      procedure linear search(x: integer, a_1, a_2, ..., a_n: distinct integers)
i := 1
while i <= n and x != a_i
  i := i + 1
if i <= n then position := i
else position := 0
return position {position is subscript of the term that equals x, or 0 if not found}

    • 이진 검색

      procedure binary search(x: integer, a_1, a_2, ..., a_n: increasing integers)
i := 1
j := n
while i < j
  m := (i + j) / 2
  if x > a_m then i := m + 1
  else j := m
if x = a_i then position := i
else position := 0
return position
  • 정렬

    • 버블 정렬

      procedure bubble sort(a_1, a_2, ..., a_n: real number with n >= 2)
for i := 1 to n-1
  for j:= 1 to n-i
    if a_j > a_j+1 then swap a_j and a_j+1

    • 선택 정렬

      procedure insertion sort (a_1, a_2, ..., a_n: real numbers with n >= 2)
for j := 2 to n
  i := 1
  while a_j > a_i
  i := i + 1
  m := a_j
  for k := 0 to j - i - 1
  a_{j-k} := a_{j-k-1}
  a_i := m
  • 그리디 알고리즘

The Growth of Functions

Big-O Notation

  • is if there exists a constant and such that for all
  • is if
  • 당연히 여러개일 수 있다.
  • 가 아니라

Example


  • is

  • is

  • $f(n) is
  • is and is
    is
    is
  • and both
    is

Big-Ω Notation

  • when

Big-θ Notation

  • is and is

Complexity of Algorithms

combination of funciton

if and , then


ordering functions by order of growth

big-omega

lowerbound: if there exists a constant and such that for all

big-theta

if and

complexity

item.title: Number Theory and Cryptography
item.description:
Solving Congruences

RS Encryption

Linear Congruences

Inverse of a modulo m

Finding Inverses1

Fermat’s Little Theorem

Cryptography

Caesar Cipher

The RSA Cryptosystem

euiler function:
euiler’s theorem: if a is invertible mod k, then
n = pq
select e such that gcd(e,ϕ(p,q)) = 1
m: message, c = m^e mod n
publock key: (e,m)
d: inverse of e mod ϕ(p,q)
ed = 1 + kϕ(p,q) for some integer k
